title: Turkey Could be One of the Countries Most Hit by CBAM
author: Fastener World
text:
GOVERNMENTS/ASSOCIATIONS/FASTENER GROUPS  
              
               Turkey Could be One of the Countries Most Hit by CBAM 
              
             Turkey Could be One of the Countries Most Hit by CBAM 
              Add to my favorite 
  
 2023-11-06 

                           Hurriyet Daily News reported that Ankara Chamber of Industry (ASO) Chairman Seyit said that Turkey will probably be one of the countries most hit by CBAM. The chairman said that Turkey cannot afford to miss this green transformation and the delay will be costly. 

      The Chairman said that from an economic point of view, the carbon tax is expected to cost Turkey more than 60 billion dollars by 2040. He said Turkey's non-participation in the India-Middle East-Europe Corridor (IMEC) program was a loss and emphasized that Turkey had not benefited enough from China's Belt and Road Initiative (BRI). Easier and cheaper access to the Middle East and European markets by India and China means increased competition for Turkey in the near future.
